Author: Gordon Komodo#7477
Content: kmd notaries have 75% network hashrate so an attacker has to be able to control 26% of notaries and 25% of hashrate . Notary operators are elected publicly , so Notaries operator likely won't risk the chance üòÑ

Author: Gordon Komodo#7477
Content: if btc hashrate goes to shit , then KMD can notarize to Verus chain or any other more secure chains

Author: Hermes#6934
Content: Here is a little explanation from our devs on how DPOW works https://support.komodoplatform.com/solution/articles/29000024853-dpow-security-explained-/en

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: KMD can change to notarize on whatever chain has the highest hashrate. if BTC dies, then BTC2 will be used. doesnt affect KMD in any permanent way if BTC hashrate goes down

Author: Zbouby#6066
Content: so what is the name of the komodo fork created? Which one is the real komodo ?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: KMD. KMD

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it is just a technical update with new consensus rules

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: not all hardforks have to be politicized and contentious

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: sometimes, you can just update the tech and have new tech

Author: modereck#4269
Content: Hi, I saw a tweet that says rewards can be claimed  on ledger by a web app, do someone have the link?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: @Zbouby we dont do technical development by voting. it is coding, not voting and this is the new codebase that is developed so why wouldnt we update?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: technology that is politicized leads to taking 4 years to not increase blocksize

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but any assetchain is free to not update to the latest, we have provision for that

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: technical decisions should be based on technology, not politics

Author: passcombo.com üè¥‚ò†üçã#0622
Content: I'm confused - is the KMD fork already in progress and we should not move our coins till 15 Dec or the fork will yet be announced before 15 Dec and finish after 15 ? The initial ann was like "till 15 Dec exchanged halted due to fork" so it sounds like no tx should be done and upgrade will take 2 weeks ?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: we are working on the final tests for the update. we hope to get it live around the 1st of Dec. that gives everyone 2 weeks to update

Author: Zbouby#6066
Content: Thank you jl777c for the explanation

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: as long as you update before Dec 15th once the update is ready, you will be fine

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: if you use lite mode, then you dont have to worry, whoever runs the SPV servers need to update

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but entire infrastructure needs to be updated, including all full nodes, mining pools, explorers, exchanges, etc. and unlike the normal update, special sapling suppport is needed as it creates a new tx version, even for taddr

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: due to this, we couldnt make it the normal, "just update komodod" process which would be much faster.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: as it is I am still concerned there isnt enough time for all things to be updated. I know it is a painful process, but we have to do this at some point and anytime would be painful.

Author: PTYX#6840
Content: Can you explain how this would play out with 500-1000 chains: "but any assetchain is free to not update to the latest, we have provision for that"

Author: PTYX#6840
Content: What provisions?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: add -ac_sapling=farfutureheight

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: or

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: just make a repo with all the current code being used and not update it
